answers.answer: There are many possible causes of chest pain, and it would be difficult to say what is causing your pain without additional information. It sounds like your mother had coronary artery disease. You describe at least two risk factors for heart disease: a family history as well as high blood pressure. While you are a young woman, it is still important to control your risk factors for coronary artery disease. This means controlling your blood pressure and cholesterol, not smoking tobacco, and preventing or treating diabetes. Of course, a heart healthy diet and exercise are important as well.Chest pain which is cardiac in nature can present in many ways. Typical chest pain comes on or gets worse with exertion or exercise, may feel like a pressure sensation, can radiate to your jaw or left arm. Cardiac chest pain may also be associated with nausea, vomiting, sweating, and shortness of breath.You should see your physician. Additional testing would be helpful in order to identify the cause of your chest discomfort.

question: I am a 33 year old female and I had preclamsia when pregnant in 2009...since then, my blood pressure has been high.  Even with proper medications, it wouldn't stabilize itself.  I had to stop the medication roughly cause my insurance stopped.  I have been since suffering from High Blood Pressure.  It ranges between 150/90 to 160/109.  I have it checked by going to my neighborhood Pharmacy (CVS).Now, recently the left side of my chest is beginning to hurt.  I touch my chest to feel the rate of my heart and it's a bit racy.  I try to lay on my left side like I was told by my previous doctor, but the pain continues, it's a bit less, but continues.  My mom passed away in 2009 from a massive stroke.  She had two clogged arteries.  She seemed pretty strong even though her heart was delicate.My question is the following...what is causing it, what other signs should I look out for and should I have it checked?Thank you in advance for your time and coopertion in this matter.Josie
title: Chest pains
